origin: A single horizontal stroke representing the number one or a boundary.
tip: The simplest radical. Think of it as a floor or a single bar.

origin: A vertical stroke representing a rod or a connection.
tip: Imagine a stick or a needle standing upright.

origin: A drop of liquid or a small mark.
tip: Think of a single drop of rain or a speck of dust.

origin: A stroke falling to the left.
tip: Like a sword swipe or a blade of grass bending left.

origin: A cover or top-piece for an object.
tip: It's like a hat on top of a character. Common in words like 'City' (市) and 'High' (高).

origin: A vertical line representing a tally mark, with a horizontal crossbar added later.
tip: It looks like a plus sign. In Chinese culture, it represents completeness or the four directions (North, South, East, West).

origin: A pictograph of a container or a basket seen from the side.
tip: It looks like an open square facing right. It usually surrounds other components and relates to containers or squares.

origin: Cracks in a turtle shell or bone used for fortune telling.
tip: Looks like a crack in a surface. Found in characters related to predicting the future.

origin: A person kneeling or a stamp of authority.
tip: Looks like a person sitting on their heels. Becomes ㄗ on the right.

origin: A steep, overhanging rock face.
tip: Like a 'Shelter' (广) but without the dot on top.

origin: A cocoon or a closed arm holding something to oneself.
tip: A small triangle. Think of a 'secret' or something tucked away.

origin: A hand reaching out to grab something repeatedly.
tip: Looks like a simplified 'X'. It often suggests action or repetition.

origin: A man of high standing or a weapon (halberd) stuck in the ground.
tip: Similar to 'Earth' (土), but the TOP line is longer than the bottom.

origin: A foot pointing downward, indicating movement.
tip: Looks like 'Large' (大) but with the top stroke bent.

origin: A foot with a dragging motion.
tip: Almost identical to 夂, but the central stroke crosses through the bottom.

origin: A crescent moon (originally half of the 'Moon' character).
tip: Think of it as a moon partially obscured by clouds at dusk.

origin: A person standing with arms and legs spread wide.
tip: A person trying to show how big something is with their whole body.

origin: A container or a place used to conceal items.
tip: Like the 'Box' radical (匚) but with the top stroke slightly longer or overhanging.

origin: A variation of the animal snout radical (彐).
tip: It has an extra stroke inside. It’s the top part of the word for 'Pig' (彘).

origin: A pictograph of a growing sprout or a bird.
tip: It looks like a bent hook or the letter 'z'.

origin: A vertical line with a flick at the bottom.
tip: Think of a fishing hook or a coat hanger.

origin: Two horizontal lines.
tip: One line for heaven, one for earth. Together they make two.

origin: A person standing or walking.
tip: Looks like two legs walking. Becomes 亻 on the left side.

origin: A person with prominent legs or a child.
tip: Look at the 'legs' at the bottom of characters like '兄' (older brother).

origin: A sharp point entering a surface.
tip: Looks like 'Person' (人) but the right leg is longer/higher, pointing 'in'.

origin: To divide or separate.
tip: Two lines moving away from each other, like things being split in half.

origin: A border or a remote area.
tip: An open container facing down; a boundary of a city.

origin: A cloth covering an object.
tip: It looks like a flat lid or a tablecloth hanging over the edges.

origin: Frozen water droplets.
tip: Two drops on the left side. Think of them as ice crystals.

origin: A small side table or bench.
tip: Looks like a little stool you could sit on.

origin: A pit or an open-mouthed container.
tip: An empty bucket or a hole in the ground.

origin: A curved blade.
tip: Looks like a cleaver. Becomes 刂 on the right side.

origin: A plow or a tensed muscle.
tip: Looks like a person leaning into hard work.

origin: A person bending over to hug or hold something.
tip: An arm reaching around to wrap a package.

origin: A tool for eating or a dagger.
tip: Looks like a small spoon or a person sitting down.

origin: An open mouth.
tip: A simple square representing anything that speaks or eats.

origin: A wall or border surrounding something.
tip: Always surrounds other characters (like a cage or border).

origin: A plant growing out of the ground.
tip: A cross on a base. The bottom line is the ground.

origin: A woman kneeling or crossing her legs.
tip: Imagine a person sitting with their legs crossed gracefully.

origin: A baby in swaddling clothes with arms out.
tip: The horizontal line represents the baby's reaching arms.

origin: A pictograph of a house with a chimney or a peak.
tip: Think of it as a protective cover over the top of a character, like a ceiling.

origin: Originally the distance from the wrist to the pulse.
tip: Looks like a hand with a mark indicating where the pulse is felt.

origin: Three small objects or grains of sand.
tip: The central line is being split into even smaller parts.

origin: A person with a bent leg or a limp.
tip: It looks like the 'person' radical (人) but with one leg kicked out awkwardly.

origin: A person lying down or a seated person acting as a proxy for the dead.
tip: Imagine a person lying flat on their back under a blanket.

origin: A plant emerging from the ground with two leaves.
tip: A 'W' shape on a stem—it's a tiny plant beginning to grow.

origin: Three mountain peaks on a horizon.
tip: The vertical lines are the peaks, the bottom line is the range.

origin: Flowing water or a stream.
tip: Three wavy vertical lines representing the current of a river.

origin: An artisan's square or a heavy tool.
tip: It looks like an 'I' beam used in construction.

origin: A thread on a loom or a coiled snake.
tip: Think of it as the shape of your own spine when sitting.

origin: A piece of cloth hanging from a hook.
tip: Looks like a towel or rag hanging over a rail.

origin: A weapon like a pestle or a forked stick.
tip: Looks like a 'T' with an extra bar—imagine clothes drying on a rack.

origin: A small twist of silk or a newborn thread.
tip: Think of it as a small knot or a tiny loop of string.

origin: A building built against a mountainside.
tip: Like 'roof' (宀) but open on the side, like a lean-to or a shed.

origin: A foot moving forward over a long distance.
tip: It stretches under the character, like a long road being walked.

origin: Two hands held up to present an offering.
tip: Imagine two hands reaching up to carry a heavy box.

origin: A wooden peg or an arrow tied to a string for retrieval.
tip: Looks like a slanted cross—think of a hunter's trap.

origin: A recurve bow used for archery.
tip: The shape perfectly mimics the tension and curves of a wooden bow.

origin: The head or snout of an animal (like a pig).
tip: It looks like a hand or a claw reaching out sideways.

origin: Long hair, feathers, or decorative rays of light.
tip: Three slanted strokes—think of them as hair or whiskers.

origin: The left half of the character for 'road' (行).
tip: Known as the 'double person' radical. It usually relates to walking or paths.

origin: A pictograph of the physical heart and its vessels.
tip: Looks like a heart with valves. Becomes 忄 on the left side.

origin: A spear with a blade attached at a right angle.
tip: A very common radical for weapons or conflict. Look for the 'hook' at the end.

origin: A single-leaf door (half of the character for double doors 門).
tip: Imagine a single swinging door on a hinges.

origin: A hand with five fingers splayed out.
tip: Becomes 扌 on the left side—it looks like a hand reaching out to grab.

origin: A hand holding a broken branch from a tree.
tip: Think of a hand (the bottom part) carrying a stick.

origin: A hand holding a stick or whip to strike.
tip: Usually appears as 攵 on the right. It looks like a person with a stick.

origin: A person with a tattoo or markings on their chest.
tip: Looks like a person with their legs crossed and arms out.

origin: A ladle or a cup used for measuring grain.
tip: Imagine the Big Dipper constellation or a soup ladle.

origin: An axe head with a handle.
tip: It looks like a sharp blade pointing down; also a unit of weight.

origin: Two boats tied together or a plow.
tip: Think of a person with a flag pointing in a certain direction.

origin: A person dancing to pray for rain, eventually meaning 'not'.
tip: Looks like a 'sky' (天) with a curled leg.

origin: A circle with a dot in the middle representing the sun.
tip: A rectangle with a line through it. Related to time and light.

origin: A mouth with a line indicating breath or speech coming out.
tip: Flatter and wider than 'sun' (日). It represents speaking.

origin: A crescent moon with two small clouds inside.
tip: Related to time. Note: Also often represents 'flesh' (肉) inside characters.

origin: A tree with branches above and roots below.
tip: A central trunk with branches (top) and roots (bottom).

origin: A person with an open mouth, exhaling or yawning.
tip: Imagine a person leaning back and sighing because they lack something.

origin: A footprint showing a foot planted on the ground.
tip: Looks like a foot pointed forward. To walk no further.

origin: A fragment of a skeleton or a broken bone.
tip: Think of a '7' on top of a broken line; represents something negative.

origin: A hand holding a long-handled spear or stick.
tip: Usually on the right. It looks like a combination of 'box' and 'friend'.

origin: A mother (母) with a line through her to forbid something.
tip: Related to prohibition. Looks like a knotted 'no'.

origin: Two people standing next to each other to check their height.
tip: Two 'spoon' radicals next to each other.

origin: Feathers or animal fur.
tip: Think of long, wispy strokes ending in a flick of hair.

origin: A root in the ground or a person carrying a heavy object.
tip: Looks like a person bowing low to their ancestors.

origin: Flowing clouds or rising vapor.
tip: Three horizontal lines with a curve—think of steam rising from coffee.

origin: A flowing stream with splashes.
tip: Often appears as 氵 (three drops) on the left side.

origin: A campfire with flames leaping up.
tip: Appears as 灬 at the bottom (like four hot coals).

origin: A bird's foot or a hand reaching down.
tip: Often appears at the top as 爫. Imagine a cat's paw.

origin: A hand holding a stone axe (authority).
tip: Looks like two sticks crossed—think of a stern parental figure.

origin: Crossing lines for divination (I-Ching).
tip: Two 'X' shapes stacked. Represents patterns.

origin: A split piece of wood.
tip: The left side of a tree trunk.

origin: The right side of a split tree trunk.
tip: Think of a thin slice of wood or a business card.

origin: Interlocking molars.
tip: Looks like a jagged edge or a tooth with a root.

origin: The head of an ox with horns.
tip: Becomes 牜 on the left. The top vertical line is the horn.

origin: A dog standing on its hind legs.
tip: Becomes 犭 on the left. The extra dot is the dog's ear.

origin: A dyed silk thread or the color of the dark sky.
tip: A 'lid' over a small knot. Represents mystery.

origin: Three pieces of jade on a string.
tip: Like 'king' (王) but with a dot representing a jewel.

origin: A melon hanging on a vine.
tip: The outer lines are the vine, the inner part is the fruit.

origin: Interlocking roof tiles.
tip: Looks like a bent piece of pottery or a tile.

origin: Something tasty being held in the mouth.
tip: A 'mouth' with a tongue-like horizontal line inside.

origin: A plant growing out of the earth.
tip: Looks like a sprout with extra leaves.

origin: A bucket or a bell used for signals.
tip: Imagine a tool or a container you can use.

origin: A plot of land divided into four parts.
tip: Looks exactly like a grid for crops.

origin: A foot or a measurement of fabric.
tip: Often relates to feet or walking in older forms.

origin: A person leaning on a bed or frame.
tip: Always found surrounding the top/left of 'illness' words.

origin: Two feet pointing away from each other.
tip: Found at the top of characters like 'climb'.

origin: A grain of rice or the sun rising.
tip: Like 'sun' (日) but with a little 'tick' on top.

origin: A hand peeling the skin off an animal.
tip: The top left is the skin, the bottom is the hand.

origin: A wide shallow vessel.
tip: Found at the bottom of characters. Looks like a trough.

origin: A pictograph of an eye turned sideways.
tip: Like 'sun' (日) but with two lines inside instead of one.

origin: A spear with a point and a handle.
tip: Looks like a tall weapon with a hook.

origin: An arrow with a tip and feathers.
tip: Looks like 'sky' (天) but the top line is shorter/pointed.

origin: A cliff with a rock underneath.
tip: The top part is the cliff, the 'mouth' shape is the stone.

origin: An altar with offerings dripping down.
tip: Appears as 礻 on the left. Relies to spirits and ancestors.

origin: An animal's footprint.
tip: Looks like a 'wrap' (勹) around a small track.

origin: A pictograph of a stalk of grain with a heavy, drooping head.
tip: It looks like 'Wood' (木) but with a drooping stroke on top representing the heavy ear of grain.

origin: A house or cover (宀) over an opening (八).
tip: Imagine a roof over a narrow entrance to a cavern.

origin: A person standing firmly on the ground.
tip: The top line is the head, the middle horizontal is the arms, and the bottom is the ground.

origin: Two stalks of bamboo with leaves hanging down.
tip: Usually appears at the top as ⺮. It looks like two small 'k' shapes.

origin: Grains of rice separated or splayed out.
tip: Looks like a 'Wood' radical (木) with two extra dots for grains.

origin: A bundle of silk threads tied together.
tip: Becomes 纟 on the left. Think of it as a coiled, wavy string.

origin: An earthenware jar with a lid.
tip: Think of it as a container for storing water or wine.

origin: A woven fishing net.
tip: Looks like a fence or a grid; often appears at the top as 罒.

origin: A head-on view of a sheep with horns and ears.
tip: The top two dots are the horns. Often indicates 'goodness' or 'justice'.

origin: Two bird feathers or wings side-by-side.
tip: Looks like a pair of wings ready to fly.

origin: An old man with long hair, leaning on a cane.
tip: The bottom part represents the walking stick used by an elder.

origin: Originally a pictograph of a beard hanging from a chin.
tip: Imagine whiskers hanging down from a horizontal face-line.

origin: A wooden tool used for tilling the soil.
tip: Related to farming; looks like a 'Tree' radical with extra handles.

origin: A pictograph of a human ear.
tip: A vertical rectangle with horizontal lines representing the folds of the ear.

origin: A hand holding a vertical brush over a surface.
tip: The horizontal lines are the fingers; the vertical line is the brush.

origin: A slice of meat with ribs or fibers showing.
tip: Almost always looks identical to 'Moon' (月) when on the left side of a character.

origin: An eye looking downward (a servant bowing).
tip: Represents loyalty or government officials.

origin: A pictograph of a nose (Chinese people point to their nose to mean 'self').
tip: Looks like an eye with a little 'tick' on top.

origin: An arrow hitting the ground (its destination).
tip: The top is the arrow; the bottom horizontal is the earth.

origin: A stone bowl used for grinding grain.
tip: Looks like a broken 'box' with teeth for grinding.

origin: A tongue sticking out of a mouth (口).
tip: The top part is the tongue; the bottom square is the mouth.

origin: Two feet walking in opposite directions.
tip: Think of 'tangled' or 'mistaken'—feet going the wrong way.

origin: A long wooden boat or canoe.
tip: Imagine the central line as the mast and the box as the hull.

origin: An eye looking back in fear or defiance.
tip: Associated with mountains or stubbornness in the I-Ching.

origin: A person on top of another person (blushing).
tip: The top part is a person, the bottom is 'hope' or 'desire'.

origin: Two blades of grass or sprouts.
tip: Almost always appears at the top as 艹.

origin: The stripes and head of a tiger.
tip: Found at the top of characters like 'Tiger' (虎) or 'Cruel' (虐).

origin: A snake or a small crawling creature.
tip: Used for anything from ants to dragons (which were seen as giant insects).

origin: A drop of blood in a sacrificial bowl (皿).
tip: It's the 'Dish' radical with a drop on top.

origin: A four-way crossroads.
tip: The left and right parts together mean 'to go' or 'travel'.

origin: A person wearing a robe or coat.
tip: Becomes 衤 on the left side. Don't confuse it with 'Spirit' (礻).

origin: A lid or a cover over a container.
tip: Found in characters like 'West' (西).

origin: An eye (目) on top of a person (儿).
tip: A person using their eyes to look at something.

origin: An animal horn used as a container or tool.
tip: Looks like a 'meat' radical with a pointed tip.

origin: A mouth (口) with words (horizontal lines) coming out.
tip: Becomes 讠 in simplified Chinese. Relates to talking and language.

origin: Water flowing out of a mountain pass into a mouth/opening.
tip: The top part is the water/pass; the bottom is the valley floor.

origin: A tall stem-bowl used for food or sacrifices.
tip: Looks like a modern kitchen scales or a pedestal bowl.

origin: A pig with a fat belly and short legs.
tip: Found in 'Home' (家)—a pig under a roof.

origin: A predator crouching or ready to pounce.
tip: Relates to cats, lions, and other wild animals.

origin: A cowrie shell used as ancient currency.
tip: Becomes 贝 in simplified. Almost always relates to money or trade.

origin: A person over a fire (the color of glowing embers).
tip: The bottom is 'Fire' (火). Think of a hot, red flame.

origin: A person waving their arms while running on a road.
tip: The top is 'Soil' (土); imagine a person running across the earth.

origin: A leg with a foot at the bottom.
tip: Becomes ⻊ on the left. Relates to kicking, walking, or feet.

origin: A pregnant woman or a person's torso.
tip: Looks like a person with a bulging midsection.

origin: An aerial view of a chariot with two wheels and an axle.
tip: Becomes 车 in simplified. Think of an axle between two wheels.

origin: A tattoo needle used to punish criminals.
tip: Relates to hardship, pungent flavors, or crime.

origin: A tool for tilling or a shellfish emerging from its shell.
tip: One of the 12 zodiac signs.

origin: A foot moving along a road.
tip: Almost always appears as the side radical 辶.

origin: A person kneeling under a city wall.
tip: Always appears as 阝 on the **right** side (Town).

origin: A fermentation vessel with liquid inside.
tip: Related to alcohol, vinegars, and medical tinctures.

origin: An animal's paw print or grains being separated.
tip: Looks like 'Rice' (米) but with a separation at the top.

origin: A field (田) with earth (土) below it; a place where people live.
tip: Think of a measured unit of land or a neighborhood.

origin: Gold nuggets buried in the earth.
tip: Becomes 钅 on the left. Relates to anything made of metal (bells, needles, money).

origin: A person with long hair and a cane.
tip: Simplified as 长. Represents distance or growth.

origin: A pair of swinging doors on hinges.
tip: Simplified as 门. It looks like a doorway frame.

origin: Steps cut into a hillside or a large cliff.
tip: Always appears as 阝 on the LEFT side (Hill/Mound).

origin: A hand catching the tail of an animal.
tip: Rare as a standalone radical, but found in 'subservient' words.

origin: A pictograph of a small, plump bird.
tip: Found in many bird names (like sparrow) and the word for 'difficult' (难).

origin: Water droplets falling from the sky (the top line).
tip: The four dots are the raindrops falling inside a window-like frame.

origin: A sprout growing (生) over a well or a dye vat.
tip: Represents the color of nature or vitality.

origin: Bird wings spread out in opposition.
tip: Looks like two combs facing away from each other; means 'opposite'.

origin: A face with eyes and an outline.
tip: Think of it as the front of a head or the surface of a table.

origin: An animal skin stretched out to be tanned.
tip: Relates to shoes, belts, and leather goods.

origin: Feet walking around a city wall (guarding a leather-bound fort).
tip: Simplified as 韦. Usually refers to flexible leather.

origin: Leeks growing in a bundle.
tip: Looks like plants in a row with horizontal soil lines.

origin: A mouth (口) with a flute or sound coming out.
tip: It is 'Stand' (立) over 'Sun/Mouth' (日). Think of a standing singer.

origin: A person with a prominent head.
tip: Simplified as 页. Relates to pages of a book or parts of the head.

origin: An insect (虫) inside a sail, moving with the air.
tip: Simplified as 风. Imagine air trapped inside a large sail.

origin: A bird with wings outstretched in flight.
tip: Simplified as 飞. It looks like a bird mid-flap.

origin: A lid over a bowl of rice.
tip: Becomes 饣 on the left. Relates to anything edible.

origin: A head with hair on top.
tip: The two dots on top are the hair; the box is the face.

origin: Grain (禾) over a sun/mouth (日)—the smell of cooking rice.
tip: Think of the sweet smell of a harvest.

origin: A horse with a mane, four legs, and a tail.
tip: Simplified as 马. The four dots are the legs running.

origin: An articulation of a joint and a bone.
tip: The top part is the joint; the bottom is the 'flesh' (月).

origin: A tall watchtower or building.
tip: It looks like a multi-story building with a roof and windows.

origin: Hair hanging down from a head.
tip: Found at the top of characters for 'hair' or 'beard'.

origin: Two people with long hair fighting.
tip: Looks like two people standing back-to-back in conflict.

origin: A container of herbs being added to wine.
tip: A very rare radical related to ancient rituals.

origin: An ancient three-legged cooking pot.
tip: Found in words related to tripod vessels or steam.

origin: A person with a large, scary head and a tail.
tip: The 'tail' (儿) at the bottom flickers like a spirit.

origin: A fish with a head, scales, and a tail.
tip: Simplified as 鱼. The four dots at the bottom are the tail/fins.

origin: A bird with a long tail and feathers.
tip: Simplified as 鸟. Distinct from 'short-tailed bird' (隹).

origin: A bag of salt with crystals showing.
tip: Relates to alkaline or salty substances.

origin: A deer with antlers and legs.
tip: The top part represents the antlers.

origin: Wheat stalks with roots.
tip: Simplified as 麦. Relates to flour and noodles.

origin: Plants hanging in a shed (广) to dry.
tip: Relates to fibers or the sensation of numbness.

origin: A person wearing a jade ornament (the color of the earth).
tip: The traditional color of the Emperor and the earth.

origin: Sticky rice or millet used for wine.
tip: Looks like 'Grain' (禾) with water drops (氺) below.

origin: Soot gathering over a fire in a chimney.
tip: The bottom is 'Fire' (灬); the top is the soot-filled chimney.

origin: A needle creating a pattern on cloth.
tip: A very ornate radical used for needlework.

origin: A pictograph of a frog seen from above.
tip: Looks like a large head with a wide body.

origin: A massive three-legged ceremonial vessel.
tip: Represents stability or authority.

origin: A drum on a stand being hit by a hand with a stick.
tip: The left is the drum; the right (支) is the hand with the stick.

origin: A rat with its head, paws, and long tail.
tip: The bottom right flick is the long tail of the rodent.

origin: A nose (自) over a mouth (the air passage).
tip: Combine 'Self' (自) and a complex base.

origin: Ears of corn or grain all growing at the same height.
tip: Simplified as 齐. Represents equality or neatness.

origin: An open mouth showing rows of teeth.
tip: Simplified as 齿. It literally looks like a diagram of gums and teeth.

origin: A dragon with a crest and a long, winding body.
tip: Simplified as 龙. One of the most famous symbols in Chinese culture.

origin: A turtle with its shell and tail.
tip: Simplified as 龟. One of the most complex pictographs in the set.

origin: A set of bamboo pipes tied together.
tip: The final Kangxi radical (#214). It represents music and harmony.
